channel.title: Java 2D RPG from scratch
channel.description:
I thought it would be fun to make a 2D game with Java, It currently does not have a name (feel free to tell me a good name). This game is completely written from scratch, every single bit of the code was written by me. The sprites are not mine, I just downloaded a sprite pack for now.
Currently the following is done: - Player walking with walking animations - Placing objects & clipping - Life bar - Game screen moves when walking
Updates by versions:
0.09 (latest): - Started working on GUI on top-left of screen - Started working on an exp/level system
0.08: - Screen size can now be changed - Improved entity system - Improved quest system - Improved dialogue system - Added small beginner quest "The Start"
0.07: - Basic main menu - Dialogue System
[img]http://i40.tinypic.com/24qk9hz.png[/img] [img]http://i39.tinypic.com/2nlxu6t.png[/img] [img]http://i42.tinypic.com/2ib24gx.png[/img] [img]http://i41.tinypic.com/256z98m.png[/img] [img]http://i40.tinypic.com/10gjogi.png[/img]

I love your MMORPG, Enzo the forty second.

Please, accept my praise for this project to prosper.

Read full topic

item.title: Java 2D RPG from scratch
item.dc:creator: @enzo42 enzo42
item.description:
@enzo42 wrote:

[quote=“Lin, post:27, topic:538119”]I know it’s an early version, but it would look much more appealing if you differed the grass up a bit, either by shading by overlaying some sort of highly-blended perlin noise or adding flowers - or both! In fact, if you used the perlin noise method you could animate it/move it across the screen and it would give the impression of clouds moving overhead which will greatly improve your game’s atmosphere. You could even go cheap and just generate a texture that’s tileable and it would hardly cost anything performance-wise.

Also, you seem to not be using a tile-based grid but instead are manually placing objects and rendering them one-by-one. This is visible on the left, as some of the tree tops get cut off by the stumps above them. Also your tree spacing on the right is bigger than the left. :)[/quote]

The trees on the right are single trees, while the ones on the left are about 20 trees as one object

I will do my best to improve the simple looking grass for sure.

Thanks for the suggestions

EDIT: Worked on the exp/level system, made a formula to calculate the experience for a level.

Currently the exp table is the following:

item.title: Java 2D RPG from scratch
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

I know it’s an early version, but it would look much more appealing if you differed the grass up a bit, either by shading by overlaying some sort of highly-blended perlin noise or adding flowers - or both! In fact, if you used the perlin noise method you could animate it/move it across the screen and it would give the impression of clouds moving overhead which will greatly improve your game’s atmosphere. You could even go cheap and just generate a texture that’s tileable and it would hardly cost anything performance-wise.

Also, you seem to not be using a tile-based grid but instead are manually placing objects and rendering them one-by-one. This is visible on the left, as some of the tree tops get cut off by the stumps above them. Also your tree spacing on the right is bigger than the left.

Read full topic

I would do a better one but I am really bad in making any kind of sprites or anything

IMO, it would look fine just omitting the background and drawing the bars right on top of the game.

^
[/quote]
^[/quote]

I’ll try it.
